blurb: The “Linked Discourses in the Woods” contains 14 discourses with verses telling the experiences of certain monks living the woods. Typically the monk is slack or negligent in some way, and a deity appears to call them out and encourage them to greater diligence.

translated_title: The Chapter on In the Woods

blurb: A monk in the forest lets his mind drift to thoughts of the lay life, but is warned by a local deity.

translations.author: ইন্দ্রগুপ্ত ভিক্ষু, বঙ্গীস ভিক্ষু, অজিত ভিক্ষু, সীবক ভিক্ষু
Claude Le Ninan, Chandhana Le Ninan

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: When a mendicant falls asleep in the middle of the day, a deity tries to rouse them up. But not all is at it seems.

translations.author: ইন্দ্রগুপ্ত ভিক্ষু, বঙ্গীস ভিক্ষু, অজিত ভিক্ষু, সীবক ভিক্ষু

translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A monk named Kassapagotta encounters a hunter in the forest and tries to dissuade him from his violent purpose. But a deity warns him not to waste his time.

translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: When a group of mendicants leave the forest in which they had been staying, the local deities lament their absence.

translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A deity warns Ānanda about getting too involved with teaching lay folk.

translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A former partner of Venerable Anuruddha, now a deity named Jālinī, tries to tempt him with heavenly pleasures. But he has seen a higher happiness.

translations.author: ইন্দ্রগুপ্ত ভিক্ষু, বঙ্গীস ভিক্ষু, অজিত ভিক্ষু, সীবক ভিক্ষু

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: When Venerable Nāgadatta spends too much time in the village, a deity admonishes him.

translations.author: ইন্দ্রগুপ্ত ভিক্ষু, বঙ্গীস ভিক্ষু, অজিত ভিক্ষু, সীবক ভিক্ষু

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A deity becomes concerned of the gossip about a certain monk who had become close with a family in the village. Taking the form of one of the women of the family, she tries to warn him; but he says a true practitioner is not concerned with gossip.

translations.author: ইন্দ্রগুপ্ত ভিক্ষু, বঙ্গীস ভিক্ষু, অজিত ভিক্ষু, সীবক ভিক্ষু

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Hearing the sounds of a city festival, a mendicant feels lonely in the forest. A deity comes to give them solace and support.

blurb: When a mendicant gives up their habit of reciting the texts, a deity questions them. But it seems they have now found peace.

blurb: A deity speaks of the fearfulness of the murmuring forest. But to a mendicant it seems delightful.

translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A group of mendicants in the forest had fallen into bad ways, becoming conceited and confused. A deity came to admonish them, making clear that they were only speaking of the badly behaved, not all mendicants.

blurb: A mendicant takes a bath in a pond and sniffs a lotus. A deity accuses him of being a “thief of scent”. For a person living a life of purity, even such a small matter is a cause for concern
